      static java.lang.String connectionToString(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel sock) 
      static FlowMap deleteFlowSpaceBySlice(java.lang.String sliceName)
      Remove all of the flowSpace associated with a slice Does NOT send updates to classifiers DOES lock the flowSpace for synchronization amended by ash: You cannot call remove on the iterator as this ignores the flowmaps interface and it assumes that what is returned from getRules is the actual data structure which holds the flow space def, which may not actually be the case.
      static java.lang.String dpidToString(long dpid) 
      static FVMatch fvMatchFromString(java.lang.String ofMatchStr)

      static java.util.Set<java.lang.Short> getPortsBySlice(long dpid, java.lang.String slice, FlowMap flowmap)
      Consult the flowspace and return the set of ports that this slice is supposed to use on this switch This function is somewhat expensive (think DB join), so the results should be cached, and then updated when the FlowSpace signals a change OFPort.OFPP_ALL (0xfffc) is used to describe that all ports are supposed to be used.
      static FlowMap getSliceFlowSpace(java.lang.String sliceName)
      Return the flowspace controlled by this slice Note that this correctly removes the "holes" caused by higher priority flowspace entries
      static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSlicesByDPID(FlowMap flowMap, long dpid)
      Consult the FlowSpace and get a list of all slices that get connections to this switch, as specified by it's DPID This function is somewhat expensive (think DB join), so the results should be cached, and then updated when the FlowSpace signals a change

        public FlowSpaceUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • getSlicesByDPID

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSlicesByDPID(FlowMap flowMap,
                                              long dpid)
        Consult the FlowSpace and get a list of all slices that get connections to this switch, as specified by it's DPID This function is somewhat expensive (think DB join), so the results should be cached, and then updated when the FlowSpace signals a change
        Parameters:
        flowMap - A map of flow entries, like that from FVConfig.getFlowSpaceFlowMap();
        dpid - As returned in OFFeaturesReply
        Returns:
        A list of names of slices, i.e., "alice", "bob", etc.

      • getSliceFlowSpace

        public static FlowMap getSliceFlowSpace(java.lang.String sliceName)
                                 throws ConfigError
        Return the flowspace controlled by this slice Note that this correctly removes the "holes" caused by higher priority flowspace entries
        Parameters:
        sliceName -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ConfigError

      • getPortsBySlice

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.Short> getPortsBySlice(long dpid,
                                             java.lang.String slice,
                                             FlowMap flowmap)
        Consult the flowspace and return the set of ports that this slice is supposed to use on this switch This function is somewhat expensive (think DB join), so the results should be cached, and then updated when the FlowSpace signals a change OFPort.OFPP_ALL (0xfffc) is used to describe that all ports are supposed to be used. If all ports are valid, then OFPP_ALL will be the only port returned.
        Parameters:
        dpid - the switch identifier (from OFFeaturesReply)
        slice - The slices name, e.g., "alice"
        Returns:
        Set of ports

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                        ConfigError
        Mini-frontend for querying FlowSpace
        Parameters:
        args -
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        ConfigError

      • getFlowMap

        public static FlowMap getFlowMap(long dpid)
                          throws ConfigError
        Get the FlowMap. If the existing flowmap is a Linear flow map then return a copy, otherwise simply return the reference to the instance.
        Parameters:
        dpid - - the dpid to cut up the flowspace. Unused in the case of the federated flowmap.
        Returns:
        a reference to the current flowmap or the subflowmap.
        Throws:
        ConfigError

      • getSubFlowMap

        public static FlowMap getSubFlowMap(long dpid)
                             throws ConfigError
        Get the FlowMap that is the intersection of the Master FlowSpace and this dpid
        Parameters:
        dpid - As returned from OFFeatureReply
        Returns:
        A valid flowmap (never null)
        Throws:
        ConfigError

      • getSubFlowMap

        public static FlowMap getSubFlowMap(FlowMap flowMap,
                    long dpid,
                    FVMatch match)
        Get the FlowMap that is the intersection of this FlowMap and the given flowSpace that is, any rule in the source flowmap that matches any part of dpid and match is added to the returned flowmap
        Parameters:
        flowMap - Source flow map
        dpid - datapathId from OFFeaturesReply
        match - a valid OFMatch() struture
        Returns:
        a valid flowMap (never null)

      • parseDPID

        public static long parseDPID(java.lang.String dpidStr)
        Convert a string to a DPID "*","all","all_dpids" --> ALL_DPIDS constant if there is a ':", treat as a hex string else assume it's decimal
        Parameters:
        dpidStr -
        Returns:
        a dpid

      • deleteFlowSpaceBySlice

        public static FlowMap deleteFlowSpaceBySlice(java.lang.String sliceName)
                                      throws ConfigError
        Remove all of the flowSpace associated with a slice Does NOT send updates to classifiers DOES lock the flowSpace for synchronization amended by ash: You cannot call remove on the iterator as this ignores the flowmaps interface and it assumes that what is returned from getRules is the actual data structure which holds the flow space def, which may not actually be the case.
        Parameters:
        sliceName -
        Throws:
        ConfigError
